column4: WRAPUP 3-Anemic U.S. factory data points to moderate growth bounce

column4: U.S. manufacturing growth holds at low level in April  employment shrinks: ISM
column5: NEW YORK The pace of U.S. manufacturing growth held at its slowest in almost two years in April  as a rebound in new orders was offset by employment shrinking to its lowest level in more than five years  according to an industry report released on Friday.

column5: MENLO PARK  Calif.  April 30 In the 1980s when Sony and Toshiba were setting the agenda in the global TV and memory chip markets Japan was bristling with confidence as a hub of technological innovation.

column5: NEW YORK With prices for top-tier works of art at an all-time high  records for paintings and sculpture appear certain to fall at upcoming spring auctions in New York by Christie's and Sotheby's.

column4: Record prices for paintings  sculpture eyed at N.Y. auctions
column5: NEW YORK  May 1 With prices for top-tier works of art at an all-time high  records for paintings and sculpture appear certain to fall at upcoming spring auctions in New York by Christie's and Sotheby's.

column4: Sysco says U.S. FTC got market definition wrong in merger fight
column5: Sysco Corp  urging regulatory approval of its plan to buy its biggest rival  US Foods  has criticized antitrust authorities over how they have evaluated market competition in the sector.

column4: Third Point takes stake in Yum! Brands  stock climbs
column5: BOSTON Billionaire investor Daniel Loeb said on Friday his hedge fund has taken a new position in Yum! Brands   sending the fast-food restaurant company's stock up nearly 7 percent.

column4: UPDATE 1-Third Point takes stakes in Yum! Brands  Devon Energy
column5: BOSTON  May 1 Hedge fund Third Point told investors Friday it has taken new positions in Yum! Brands  and Devon Energy and thinks U.S. stocks remain attractive because economic data should improve and a near-term rate hike seems unlikely.

column4: Shell  Total align trading and refining units to drive profit growth
column5: LONDON Top oil firms Royal Dutch Shell and Total are bringing their refining and trading operations closer together  seeking alternative ways to drive profits as oil prices fall and independent trading houses expand into their territory.

column4: Shell  Total align trading and refining units to drive profit growth
column5: LONDON  May 1 Top oil firms Royal Dutch Shell  and Total are bringing their refining and trading operations closer together  seeking alternative ways to drive profits as oil prices fall and independent trading houses expand into their territory.

column4: UPDATE 3-TransCanada profit lifted by U.S. pipeline operations
column5: May 1 TransCanada Corp  Canada's second largest pipeline operator  reported a 10 percent rise in comparable earnings  helped by the positive impact of a stronger U.S. dollar on its U.S. pipeline operations and profits at its power businesses.

column4: Energy East project could go ahead with one export port -TransCanada CEO
column5: May 1 TransCanada Corp is still mulling alternative sites for a second oil export terminal for its Energy East pipeline  though the C$12 billion project could go ahead with just one export port  chief executive Russ Girling said on Friday.

column4: Pipeline operator TransCanada's net profit falls on derivatives
column5: May 1 TransCanada Corp   Canada's second-largest pipeline company  reported a 6.1 percent fall in quarterly net profit  hurt by derivative losses.

column4: Deals of the day- Mergers and acquisitions
column5: May 1 The following bids  mergers  acquisitions and disposals were reported by 2000 GMT on Friday:

column4: Turquoise Hill deal to exit Mongolia miner SouthGobi falls through
column5: TORONTO  May 1 A deal that would have allowed Canada's Turquoise Hill Resources Ltd to unload its remaining stake in Mongolian coal miner SouthGobi Resources  a company that was once worth billions of dollars  has fallen through.

column4: CANADA STOCKS-TSX climbs  led by Valeant  materials and banks
column5: TORONTO  May 1 Canada's main stock index advanced on Friday to recoup most of the previous session's losses  led by broad gains in financials and mining firms as well as some positive earnings reports.

column4: MOVES-Wells Fargo appoints Kyle Hranicky head of corporate banking
column5: May 1 Wells Fargo & Co  the largest U.S. mortgage lender  appointed Kyle Hranicky head of its corporate banking group  effective immediately.
